case.name: Simandl v Secure Funding Pty Ltd [2009] FCA 418 (27 April 2009)

citation.tocase: Australian Securities and Investments Commission v Edensor Nominees Pty Limited [2001] HCA 1 ; (2001) 204 CLR 559
citation.text: The authorities dealing with that provision establish that the intention of the provision is to place State courts exercising federal jurisdiction on the same general footing as the federal courts that could be created by Parliament. The leading authorities are Felton v Mulligan [1971] HCA 39 ; (1971) 124 CLR 367 and Australian Securities and Investments Commission v Edensor Nominees Pty Limited [2001] HCA 1 ; (2001) 204 CLR 559.

The authorities dealing with that provision establish that the intention of the provision is to place State courts exercising federal jurisdiction on the same general footing as the federal courts that could be created by Parliament. The leading authorities are Felton v Mulligan [1971] HCA 39 ; (1971) 124 CLR 367 and Australian Securities and Investments Commission v Edensor Nominees Pty Limited [2001] HCA 1 ; (2001) 204 CLR 559.
